revised_title: The Impact of Sodium Nitrate on Lucerne Root-Hair Infection by Nodule Bacteria
tldr: The study investigates the effects of sodium nitrate on the infection of Lucerne root-hairs by nodule bacteria. It shows that nitrates reduce the number and size of nodules, and affect the growth and physiology of the host plant, potentially due to a reduction in available carbohydrates. The research focuses on understanding the mechanism of nitrate action on root infection and nodule formation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
